channel.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
channel.description:
Lets find out the answer to the biggest question in LIFE!!
LINUX or WINDOWS!
Currently i have used all windows OS's, And alot of Linux Kernals and i would have to say linux, Because of the power and because of the freedom, I suggest Red Hat for Beginers Then Slackware or Konoppix after you get the hang of it.
I am curently using the latest version of slackware and i am testing the latest linux kernal, The latest kernal is and is untested so it may not work probly but the latest Dist of Slackware 10.2 includes the Linux 2.4.31 kernel, with Linux 2.6.13 available in the /testing directory. tHIS IS GREAT ground breaking news if you are a fan of linux!!
But hey windows has its upsides to :)... It looks pritty :)
Lol not as prittty as a fully customized Gnome or KDE desktop on linux!! MY answer for this Question would have to be Linux 2.6.13 (slackware or OpenBSD) Tell me what you think, Tiddlies.

item.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Linux… for the things you want.
Windows… for the things you want and don’t want.

Linux is the best. There should be a website called linuxisthebest.com

OMG LOOK!
https://secure.registerapi.com/dds2/index.php?siteid=42566&DomainName=linuxisthebest&comtld=.com&nettld=.net&orgtld=.org&x=343&y=177&=submit

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
item.dc:creator: @anarkial anarkial
item.description:
@anarkial wrote:

Muahuahuahuahua! L1nux 0wnz J00!!!

Well, almost. Have you tried to run a Linux on an old Sony Vaio desktop?
The fan keeps going and going and going…because the fan’s not ACPI controlled.
Even when I run micro$oft windbloze on it, I have to install a patch to keep the fan under control.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
item.dc:creator: @Dodian Dodian
item.description:
@Dodian wrote:

Fedora pl0z? I prefer KDE, but Fedora's gnome isn't bad. And yeah wine lets you play some games, but linux is mainly for servers and security. Not bad for workstations with newer distros either though Not to mention you save like $100+ on new comps (and more if you use OpenOffice instead of MS office)

Read full topic
item.source: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question

item.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
item.dc:creator: @blackhat blackhat
item.description:
@blackhat wrote:

jme_009:

Er... AFI, Are you serious?

Well anyways, linux is an operating system, sort of. Actually it's not quite an operating system(hard to explain sorta) but there are different linux distro's which are the actual operating systems. They are faster and safer then windows, and great for developer's. Usually servers use linux because of it's security. But, linux cannot do some things that windows can do; it doesnt have support for directx which makes gaming really hard, and many programs are designed to work with windows only.

If linux could do EVERYTHING that windows could do, then I'd switch. But my game doesn't even work on an emulator lol.

HAHAHAHAHA u must be a linux nooblet then hey mate, There is not one thing Linux cant do that windows can!! the Thing is if WINDOWS could do everything Linux could i would switch to WINBL0WZ!!! , BTW u ever hered of wine and SAMBA!!

Wine emulates windows so u can plkay (quake4, CSSOURCE, WOW) i play RS on linux and i also update ARYAN!
And SAMBA lets linux connect to windows via a network! So linux can do ever thing WINDOWS can and much much much more!![br][size=1]Posted at: April 22, 2006, 10:28:04 pm[/size][hr]Guys guys guys,
U are all spreding harsh rummers about linux!!!

Linux does support DIRECT X im playing FAR CRY ATM directx9 (wine emulation)

And WIFI is piss easy with Gnome or KDE!!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Linux or Winbl0wz Lifes main Question
item.dc:creator: @deadlycow21 deadlycow21
item.description:
@deadlycow21 wrote:

jme_009:

Er... AFI, Are you serious?

Well anyways, linux is an operating system, sort of. Actually it's not quite an operating system(hard to explain sorta) but there are different linux distro's which are the actual operating systems. They are faster and safer then windows, and great for developer's. Usually servers use linux because of it's security. But, [glow=red,2,300]linux[/glow] cannot do some things that [glow=red,2,300]linux[/glow] can do, it doesnt have support for directx which makes gaming really hard, and many programs are designed to work with windows only.

If linux could do EVERYTHING that windows could do, then I'd switch. But my game doesn't even work on an emulator lol.

linux can never quite do what linux can do....

I personally love linux but i cant use it for a couple of reasons....

one: everything runs on windows (Including every virus ever made )
two: i run on WiFi which is very very very hard to set up on linux
three: well, that's it, I love linux, it just isnt for me

Read full topic
